result.execSummary:
The defendant Eugene L Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First-Restitution in amount of $1,100.00 to victim's mother Barbara J.
Second- $300.00 to New Pitts Mortuary LLC.
Third_ Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees.
To be paid with up to 25% of prison funds. Balance due prior to end of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment with  tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and/or agent.

AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens with no positive results.  
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen DNA to the State Crime Lab for testing, if not previously done so.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession  of any firearms, body armor, weapons, ammunition at any time in the future.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Second Motion to Enlarge Time to File to File Appellant's Brief on Appeal
per order dated November 9, 2016, Appeal 2016XX1032CR, the deadline for Patterson to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to January 5, 2017.
MOTION TO ENLARGE TIME TO FILE,  TO FILE APPELLANT'S BRIEF ON APPEAL
State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel.

per order dated July 22, 2016, Appeal 2016XX1032CR, On or Before September 6, 2016, the public defender shall appoint successor counsel for Patterson. Successor Counsel in this matter shall advise this court of his or her appointment within five days after it is made. The deadline for Patterson to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through the date sixty days after the date successor counsel is appointed. First Assistant State Public Defender Andrea Taylor Cornwall shall ensure that successor counsel receives a copy of this order.
Motion for leave to appont successor counsel and for an extension of time to file a notice of appeal or postconviction motion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eugene L Patterson in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny and Colin McGinn.  Defendant Eugene L Patterson in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.    Additional statements made by the victim's girlfriend, sister, and mother. Additional statement made by the Defendant's nephew.
Presentence report reviewed. 

COURT SENTENCED THE Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS, with credit for 248 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 9 YEARS.  

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  1st,   Restitution in the amount of $1,100.00 to the Victim's mother Barbara J.
*  2nd,  $300.00 to New Pitts Mortuary LLC.
*  3rd,   Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing, if not previously done so.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Notice or Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Filed:
- Restitution cover letter
- Department of Justice Award letter

-Restitution Worksheet

State has been notified and stipulates to adjournment.  Defense counsel will contact PSI writer and inform them that they need to contact the Court about an extension for submission of the PSI.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 1/22/16 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.
Received and filed. lms
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Eugene L Patterson in court with attorney Neil Callahan Mcginn.  Defendant Eugene L Patterson in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AMENDED CHARGE:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

Court ordered charge amended to 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.02 (1), a Class B felony

Defendant Eugene L Patterson in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant Eugene L Patterson in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Amended Information recieved and filed.  Amended the Incident location and specific information regarding the weapon.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.

Final Pretrial Proceeded.  State to call 15 witnesses and Defense to call at least 4-5 witnesses.  Parties to subpoena witnesses. Parties addressed the defendant's relevant convictions and also for the witnesses.  State not to provide Character Evidence.  State to call expert witness.  No Miranda Goodchild issues.  Parties will continues discussions of resolution.

Defendant Eugene L Patterson in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny and Colin McGinn.  Defendant Eugene L Patterson in custody.  Antoni Apollo for Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #95CF611 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Gust Petropoulos-MPD Detective.   Stipulation that the deceased victim, Willie Woods Jr. died due to a gun shot at close range is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eugene L Patterson in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Eugene L Patterson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
